subtitle: Also known as 'La Reine soup' as it's believed that the mother of Mary Queen of Scots brought the recipe to Scotland from France. The soup is thickened with almonds which was quite usual then. This recipe uses a food processor although originally the ingredients would have been pounded by hand.

method.text: Shell the eggs. Separate the yolks from the whites. Chop the yolks and whites separately. Save the egg whites for garnish.
Put the egg yolks, almonds and chicken breast into a food processor. Add enough chicken stock to enable you to process to a smooth puree.
Pour the remaining chicken stock into a pan. Add the chicken puree with the breadcrumbs, cream and seasoning. Heat thoroughly, stirring, but do not allow the soup to boil, otherwise it will curdle.
Serve in warmed bowls. Garnish with the chopped egg whites.

title: Lorraine soup
